poem:
Matters of Vital Ink

In a room of rubber stamps,  
words sharp as needles pierce.  
Delay seems a form of mercy,  
infant futures balanced on scales,  
the weight of certainty,  
meeting minutes etched like  
fine-script prayers in ledger,  
a lull beneath fluorescents,  
where goodnight lullabies wait—  
for morning, for reason's balm,  
for their tiny, untouched arms.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "CDC advisers delay vote on restricting infant hepatitis B vaccinations in tense meeting After a contentious meeting, vaccine advisers for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) voted on Thursday to delay a vote on restricting hepatitis B vaccination for infants until Friday. The meeting of the advisory committee on immunization practices (ACIP) turned confrontational at times before one member introduced a motion to delay the vote, which passed by six to three,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: CDC advisers delay vote on restricting infant hepatitis B vaccinations in tense meeting After a contentious meeting, vaccine advisers for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) voted on Thursday to delay a vote on restricting hepatitis B vaccination for infants until Friday. The meeting of the advisory committee on immunization practices (ACIP) turned confrontational at times before one member introduced a motion to delay the vote, which passed by six to three,
